entry.title: Movie: 300, directed by Zack Snyder (2007) (3)
entry.content:
Movie: 300, directed by Zack Snyder (2007) (3)20160811
We watched this together on Vidangel. It was pretty fun and very
little was lost from the censoring. I recently listened to an
audio-book about the battle and Sparta, so I was a bit let down by
the movie missing some really cool parts of the real
story. Nevertheless, it was cool.
  • Movies
  • 2007

entry.title: Movie: Knight and Day, starring Tom Cruise (2010) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: Knight and Day, starring Tom Cruise (2010) (2)20160808
This movie is so crazy and hilarious. I love all the funny moments
of conversation and absurdity. A real classic! I think the ending
is a little bit too silly when she is suddenly very capable, but I
think it works to make the movie have internal symmetry.
  • Movies
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: Eddie the Eagle, starring Taron Egerton (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: Eddie the Eagle, starring Taron Egerton (2016)20160807
We thought this movie was very cute. It opened very strong and the
character was very funny. I thought that his struggles was very
sweet. I did a bit of reading about him after and was appalled to
learn that the Olympics committee was so opposed to him and ensured
he was excluded in the future.
  • Movies
  • 2016

entry.title: Movie: The Finest Hours, starring Chris Pine (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: The Finest Hours, starring Chris Pine (2016)20160806
I enjoyed this movie. It was very tense and the 50s are a very cute
time period to us. I thought it was strange that Chris Pine's
character wasn't especially gun-ho about saving anyone, but instead
just kept his head down and did his duty. There were many moments
that were more subdued than I would have expected.
  • Movies
  • 2016

entry.title: Movie: What If, starring Daniel Radcliffe (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: What If, starring Daniel Radcliffe (2016)20160805
This was a hilarious movie with so many cute lines and moments. The
characters felt very really and flesh out. Harry Potter and Kylo
Ren were both quite good.
  • Movies
  • 2016

entry.title: Book: The Hero of Ages, by Brandon Sanderson (2008) (4)
entry.content:
Book: The Hero of Ages, by Brandon Sanderson (2008) (4)20160801
I finished the book today. The scenes about Vin's ascension were
totally awesome and the ending was very interesting. Now, I feel
like I read it too quickly.
  • Books
  • 2008

entry.title: Movie: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, starring Daniel Radcliffe (2007)
entry.content:
Movie: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, starring Daniel Radcliffe (2007)20160731
We finished this audiobook yesterday and so it was time to watch
the movie. I feel like this is a case where the movie lacked so
much detail from the book, it was almost hard to understand. There
were definitely some parts that were much better in the movie, like
the torment of Umbridge and the actual meetings of the D.A., but
many other things were much more sketchy and left out.
  • Movies
  • 2007

entry.title: Book: The Hero of Ages, by Brandon Sanderson (2008) (3)
entry.content:
Book: The Hero of Ages, by Brandon Sanderson (2008) (3)20160730
I just read the chapter where Spook realizes he's been had. It's so
awesome, because he forgot about something in him, just like we the
reader had, even when the book explicitly went out of its way to
talk about it and how people often forget about them! Brilliant!
  • Books
  • 2008

entry.title: Book: The Hero of Ages, by Brandon Sanderson (2008) (2)
entry.content:
Book: The Hero of Ages, by Brandon Sanderson (2008) (2)20160729
It is so cool and crazy how all the weird Hemalurgy rituals work. I
love the creepiness of Ruin sneaking in to control people. This
book is so wild and awesome!
  • Books
  • 2008

entry.title: Movie: Allegiant, starring Shailene Woodley (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: Allegiant, starring Shailene Woodley (2016)20160729
Maybe I'm not remembering totally correctly, but this movie felt
quite different from the book. It was definitely fun though,
although a bit too much of a sketch of what was happening in the
book, which had more intrigue. I can see why it didn't do very well
in the box office.
  • Movies
  • 2016

entry.content:
Movie: The Ramen Girl, starring Brittany Murphy (2008)20160728
This was a cute and silly movie. I wish that it talked more about
actually how to make ramen though.

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 10 - Mother's Mercy (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 10 - Mother's Mercy (2)20160727
This was a very depressing episode with things getting worse for
almost everyone. I think it is very telling that Melissandre is
excited about the thaw, as though she wasn't sure it would really
happen. It's sad that Brienne missed Sansa's signal... I wonder
if she'll ever tell her. Arya's attack on Trant was awesome, but
it is very sad that she's now blind. It's cute that Tyrion and
Varys are now best buds teaming up. It's ridiculous that Ellaria
kills Mrycella just when she has a great bonding moment with
Jaime. Cersei's walk was very intense and it is interesting to
realize that she is now totally determined to destroy every last
one of them. It is telling that Davos' first question is about
Shireen. It's cool that Sam will be a maester. The mutiny of the
Night's Watch was crazy.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 7 - The Gift (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 7 - The Gift (2)20160726
The events at Castle Black were stirring. Theon is such a
coward. I think that given that Stannis ends up sacrificing
Shireen, he should have done it right away to get the most value
from it. Bronn's scene was weird and had unnecessary
nudity. Cersei's scene was so sinister at the beginning and it
was a great novelty to see her triumph turn to defeat. Jorah is
such a glutton for punishment. It's interesting that Sansa first
hears about Jon now, especially because they've never had a scene
together.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 8 - Hardhome (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 8 - Hardhome (2)20160726
I liked the scene between Tyrion and Dany. I think he'll be a
good influence. Arya's scenes as Lanna are very cool. I feel like
Sam's pep talk to Olly will inspire him to kill Jon. The scene is
Hardhome was totally intense. It's sad it was so unsuccessful. I
like Dany's plan to "break the wheel".
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 9 - The Dance of Dragons (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 9 - The Dance of Dragons (2)20160726
Alliser is surprisingly noble in this episode. I'm glad he takes
his vows seriously. Shireen's demise was very intense. Doran is
very interesting guy, I feel like it would be nice to see more of
him. It's cool that Arya is about to get someone on her
list. Dany's scene was amazing.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Book: The Hero of Ages, by Brandon Sanderson (2008)
entry.content:
Book: The Hero of Ages, by Brandon Sanderson (2008)20160725
I started reading this today. The opening scenes were very cool. I
like that we have an explanation of sorts of why Marsh turned
against Sazed. I really don't like that Elend is a particularly
powerful Allomancer, because I really like Vin being the most
powerful one around. I really would have wanted her to be even more
powerful as a result of her touch with the Well. Nevertheless, it
was an awesome scene.

--

There are some really cool ideas in these opening chapters. I love
the journal entries at the top of each chapter: the idea that the
Lord Ruler really was more of a hero than people thought and that
he literally moved around the planet as a way to fight the
Mists... it's very intriguing. I like the idea that you can only
trust your thoughts because Ruin is so powerful. I suspect that the
Inquisitors killed all the Terrisman Keepers because it is a vital
ingredient in making them more powerful. This explains why the Lord
Ruler hunted them for so long.
  • Books
  • 2008

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 5 - Kill the Boy (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 5 - Kill the Boy (2)20160725
Dany's decisions are very strange in this episode. She is in a
very rough place. It is very interesting that Maester Aemon has
such feelings for Dany, whom he has never met and has no ability
to contact. I love Jon's plan and his integrity to it, but it is
very sad that no one else understands, even the people that have
seen the undead army. It is very interesting that there's tons of
dragonglass on Dragonstone. Myranda is so creepy and weird, just
like Ramsay, who is super super awkward. I really enjoyed the
poem about the Doom of Valyria.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 6 - Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 6 - Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken (2)20160725
It is very interesting and cool how Arya is learning to play "the
game of faces". I'm not totally sure what she is learning here
and I wish it would move faster. I love the little connections in
the social network of the characters, such as Tyrion bringing
news of Jorah's father. Jaime's escapade seems pretty
pointless. Baelish's scheme with Cersei is so sneaky. I'm very
surprised that the Tyrells are both now in jail. Ramsay is so
terrible. I like that Cersei really is just mindlessly scratching
the paper, because she drops the pen at the end.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones
